name: script
summary: The SVG `script` element allows to add scripts to an SVG document.

href.name: href
href.summary: The `href` attribute defines a link to a resource as a reference URL. The exact meaning of that link depends on the context of each element using it.

type.name: type
type.summary: The `type` attribute is a generic attribute and it has different meaning based on the context in which it's used.

xlink:href.name: xlink:href
xlink:href.summary: The `xlink:href` attribute defines a reference to a resource as a reference IRI. The exact meaning of that link depends on the context of each element using it.

class.name: class
class.summary: Assigns a class name or set of class names to an element. You may assign the same class name or names to any number of elements, however, multiple class names must be separated by whitespace characters.

style.name: style
style.summary: The `style` attribute allows to style an element using CSS declarations. It functions identically to the `style` attribute in HTML.

id.name: id
id.summary: The `id` attribute assigns a unique name to an element.

lang.name: lang
lang.summary: The `lang` attribute specifies the primary language used in contents and attributes containing text content of particular elements.

tabindex.name: tabindex
tabindex.summary: The `tabindex` attribute allows you to control whether an element is focusable and to define the relative order of the element for the purposes of sequential focus navigation.

xml:base.name: xml:base
xml:base.summary: The `xml:base` attribute specifies a base IRI other than the base IRI of the document or external entity.

xml:lang.name: xml:lang
xml:lang.summary: The `xml:lang` attribute specifies the primary language used in contents and attributes containing text content of particular elements.

xml:space.name: xml:space
xml:space.summary: SVG supports the built-in XML `xml:space` attribute to handle whitespace characters inside elements. Child elements inside an element may also have an `xml:space` attribute that overrides the parent's one.
